alert.note: Alert for Brooks (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 16 at 3:51PM CDT until further notice by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Brooks. * WHEN...Until 445 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in ranch fields and along FM 755. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 349 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Along FM 755 in southwest Brooks County. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Along FM 755 in southwest Brooks County is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southwestern Brooks County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
